Here is how recover a job from the last checkpoint (yes it can be
scripted =
 all through JMX):

- find out the last crawl job based on timestamp
  (ls =
-t /opt/heritrix/jobs | head -1)
- use the last crawl job name to find the =
last checkpoint directory
  (ls -t /opt/heritrix/jobs/$LAST_CRAWL_JOB/check=
points | head -1)
- use the last crawl job name to find the state directory=

- We use "fast-checkpoint", so we have to recover the state from bdbje
log=
s directory. I believe this is documented somewhere in the mailing
list. (F=
or any reasonable crawl, "fast-checkpoint" is necessary)
- From the last ch=
eckpoint directory, get both orders.xml and seeds.xml
- change "recover-pat=
h" in order.xml file to point to the last
checkpoint directory
- create a s=
cript to add a job based on order.xml and seeds.xml
- start crawling
